identificationModule.briefTitle: Data Collection for Validation of an NIBP Algorithm in Pregnant Women
identificationModule.officialTitle: Data Collection for Validation of a Noninvasive Blood Pressure Auscultatory Algorithm - Pregnant Women

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of the study is to collect per subject blood pressure data on the device's intended population as described in the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) Standard 81060-2:2018+A1:2020 Non-invasive sphygmomanometers.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
The purpose of the study is to collect data per subject NIBP measurements by (1) oscillometric means using the GE NIBP Auscultatory Algorithm and (2) by conventional auscultatory means in a pregnant population. These measurements include Systolic BP (mmHg) and Diastolic BP (mmHg). The secondary objective of this study is to collect per procedure and log files from the device. The safety objective of this study is to collect safety information, including type and number of adverse events, serious adverse events and device issues.

This is an open label, single-site, single arm, prospective, pivotal study including a training phase and a validation phase with demographics-based stratification quota. Subjects are sequentially tested with investigational and reference blood pressure measurements.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: This is an open label, single-site, single arm, prospective, pivotal study including a training phase and a data collection phase.

armGroups.label: Blood Pressure Collection
armGroups.description: This study has only 1 arm; investigational NIBP measurements will be collected using a NIBP Auscultatory Algorithm with alternating NIBP measurements collected using a reference sphygmomanometer.
interventionNames: Device: Collecting blood pressure measurements with noninvasive blood pressure device

interventions.name: Collecting blood pressure measurements with noninvasive blood pressure device
interventions.description: Noninvasive blood pressure measurements will collected based on the recommendations of the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) 81060-2:2018+A1:2020 Non-invasive sphygmomanometers -Clinical investigation of intermittent automated measurement type. This study has only 1 arm; investigational NIBP measurements will be collected using a NIBP Auscultatory Algorithm with alternating NIBP measurements collected using a reference sphygmomanometer.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Collection of per subject NIBP measurements
primaryOutcomes.description: The primary objective of this study is to collect per subject NIBP measurements by oscillometric means using the GE NIBP Auscultatory Algorithm and by conventional auscultatory means in a pregnant population. These measurements include both Systolic BP (mmHg) and Diastolic BP (mmHg).
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Start of blood pressure acquisition until three valid pairs obtained, approximately one hour

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Collection of per procedure and device log files.
secondaryOutcomes.description: The secondary objective of this study is to collect per procedure and device log files.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Start of blood pressure acquisition until three valid pairs obtained, approximately one hour

otherOutcomes.measure: Number of Safety Events and Device Issues
otherOutcomes.description: The safety objective of this study is to collect safety information, including type and number of adverse events, serious adverse events, and device issues.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Start of blood pressure acquisition until three valid pairs obtained, approximately one hour
